Incident.Summary: Comp advised he had four (4) tires stolen from his property. No descriptive information provided pertaining to the stolen tires. The tires were valued at $1,200 USC. Victim advised he believed a w/m Michael Gott is the suspect. No CCTV.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Maryland State Police TPR J. Hicks, IBM 7576 June 18th, 2023 MSP Patrol Vehicle:X-24is a marked, black, Ford Explorer that is equipped with a functioning camera. I am equipped with a body worn camera that was also activated during the stop. Incident location:5468 Cornstack Road, Marion Station, Somerset County, Maryland. Victim:Eugenio Rincon Date of Birth:10/24/1976 TN SDX:127043281 Suspect:Michael Anthony Gott Date of Birth: 10/25/1999 MD SDX: G-300-603-067-822 Suspect:Mark Anthony Gott Date of Birth: 03/21/2003 Officers Training/Experience *Trained in administering Standardized Field Sobriety Tests through the Eastern Shore Criminal Justice Academy and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA). 2015. * Trained in administering Standardized Field Sobriety Tests through the Maryland State Police and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA).2022. * Trained and certified to operate Radar and Lidar through the Maryland State Police. *NHTSA certified in Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (A.R.I.D.E). * CDS detection, recognition, packaging, distribution, classification and indicator training from ESCJA police academy (2015) and Maryland State Police Academy (2022). * Gangs 101 *MPCTC Basic Instructor (general instructor/ defensive tactics) * Numerous CDS arrests and convictions in Wicomico County, Maryland Courts as a previous Police Officer/ Detective with the Salisbury Police Department. Processing: - No CCTV - No processing completed Narrative: This report has been prepared based upon the observations of this trooper and/or those of other troopers relative to the offense(s). The facts contained herein are intended solely to give the prosecuting authority a basic understanding of the facts pertaining to this case. The facts contained herein are not intended to be an exhaustive recitation of the facts pertaining to pretrial or trial issues. Instead, this trooper anticipates that during the pretrial proceedings in this case, the prosecutor will take the opportunity to interview this trooper in order to ascertain any and all relevant facts which might be the subject of this troopers testimony during court proceedings. Assignment: On June 18th, 2023 I was working an early shift patrol assignment in Somerset County, Maryland. Narrative: On 06/18/2023 at approximately 0953 hours, I was dispatched to 5468 Cornstack Rd, Marion Station, Somerset County, Maryland in reference to a theft. Upon arrival, I met with a hispanic male complainant/victim identified by his Tennessee ID card as Eugenio Rincon (DOB: 10/24/1976). Rincon advised on 06/16/2023 at approximately 1600 hours, he last saw a set of automobile tires and rims that he stored underneath of the porch attached to his residence. Rincon advised on 06/18/2023 at approximately 0700 hours, he discovered said tires and rims were missing. Rincon further described said tires and rims as follows: Make: Unknown Model: Unknown Size: Unknown Information: Believed to be mounted on black 5 lug wheels. Rincon advised he believed a white male whom he identified as only as Michael Gott was involved. Rincon advised that Michael Gott and his brother Mark Gott are both known to steal items in the Westover, Fairmount, Marion, Crisfield areas. Rincon advised that Mark used to work for him a few years ago, and he was suspected of stealing tools from a work van. Rincon advised on 06/17/2023 his mother was at his residence when she observed a red, older model Honda car (believed to be a two-door Honda Civic) exiting the driveway of the residence. Rincon believes that Michael Gott is the primary suspect due to him owning a vehicle matching the description provided. Rincon advised that his mother observed the vehicle leaving from the rear of his residence. It should be noted no theft was observed, however Rincon believed this behavior was unusual. On 06/18/2023, I conducted a query of the name Michael Gott and Mark Gott through the MSP Delta Plus Database. This search revealed the following personal identifying information: Name: Michael Anthony Gott DOB: 10/25/1999 Address: 30549 Marumsco Rd, Marion Station, Maryland or 50 Somers Cove, Crisfield, Maryland Name: Mark Anthony Gott DOB: 03/21/2003 Address: 30549 Marumsco Rd, Marion Station, Maryland 21838 I responded to 30549 Marumsco Rd and 50 Somers Cove in an attempt to locate Michael Gott, however met with negative results. While at the residences, I conducted a plain view search of the area for wheels, tires, rims or anything resembling the items described by Rincon. I was unable to locate any items matching the description. After leaving 50 Somers cove, I received a phone cal from Michael Gott in reference to this investigation. Gott advised that he did stop by Rincons residence to say hi, however he was not there. Gott advised that he left shortly after arriving. Gott advised that he did not steal the wheels, nor did he have information pertaining to their whereabouts. Gott advised that he would contact Maryland State Police Princess Anne Barrack if he receives any investigative leads. It should be noted, the items stolen cannot be placed into NCIC due to having no identifiable markings, numbers, engravings or make/model etc. I will be unable to conduct pawn searches for these items due to not having enough descriptive information to definitively identify said wheels. Rincon was provided a case number, barrack phone number and my email to contact me if he obtains any additional investigative information. Due to having no further information to follow-up with, I respectfully request this case be closed. I will re-open/investigate this case if an investigative lead is obtained. All events occurred in Somerset County, Maryland.

IncidentProperty.Description: Four (4), unknown make, unknown model, unknown size automobile tires. These tires were mounted on unknown style black rims.
